name: Hilton Saint John

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Saint John in a rennovated room. We were waterfront and found the staff helpful. Buffet breakfast was very good and the room was cleaned very well daily. This hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of downtown including shopping and dinning choices.
reviews.title: Wonderful Waterfront

reviews.text: We rented 2 rooms. My room was a harbor view and was excellent. My brother had a downtown-facing room. There are outside bars along the wharf and have bands playing. He had to have his room moved twice so that he could sleep. They play until midnight. This is a summer thing, so beware and spend the extra few dollars to get a harbor view room.
reviews.title: Downtown view rooms are loud at night in the summer...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, I didn't have to pay the parking fee, as I had a carrier on my SUV roof racks and it wouldn't fit in the garage. I was allowed to park adjacent to the hotel and not incur a parking charge...Very beautiful hotel and location. Pool was just basic though.
reviews.title: Smelly

reviews.text: To intially walk into the Hotel it looks fine and the staff wasn't too bad in the helpful department. Our room wasn't ready at the moment so we were given another room. The room was funny smelling. The bathroom looked like the sink was going to fall off the wall, the bathroom floor had hair all over it along with in the tub. I really couldn't wait to get out of there.
reviews.title: Great Room

reviews.text: Booked a room with aking size bed for the wife & I for after our company Christmas dinner. Great bed & great view of the harbour. Will do the same next year!
reviews.title: Probably the best of a rather limited selection

reviews.text: Great downtown location helpful staff dirty room on the ninth floor as it was not renovated yet. We were with a large group of travellers and moved to another hotel because of the quality of the rooms we were in. Once they finish upgrading the whole place I would stay there but not before.
reviews.title: Stay away from the unrenovated rooms at the Hilton

reviews.text: We usually drive from Maine to Prince Edward Island once a year and this makes for an easy overnight stopover. The location is perfect for a business or leisure traveler (first exit after Saint John tolls, take your first right and you're there). Don't underestimate the "easy directions" factor, as we pulled off in a driving rain storm twice to stay here.
reviews.title: Good Experience Many Times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was probably the 6th time we've stayed here and it's a good value for the location, although I'm sure you can find cheaper lodging - especially if you're just looking for a place to sleep. We like the fact that you can walk anywhere (especially in the rain) through the downtown shopping mall district. Skip the hotel breakfast and head over to Cora's. Lots of fresh fruit and you'll save about $8 per person.
reviews.title: Beautiful view

reviews.text: One big downside - parking is about $15 in the garage across the street.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: Hotel was average at best. View was amazing and the restaurant staff were so friendly and helpful. Front staff not so much...3 times had to go back to front desk after checking in to get keys done so we could get into the room. Front staff told us one room but actually had booked us into another room and then keys still wouldn't work. Bell Hop was the most helpful of the bunch. There is also a nasty smell in the basement and underground parking area, assume it has something to do with the ocean. City is really a beautiful city and one i would definately visit again. Parking was extra as well was internet service. In todays day internet is free everywhere. Nice place with a fantastic buffet breakfast to start the day off with a beautiful view
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: The Hilton in Saint John, is my ideal hotel. If I could take this exact hotel and staff and put it where ever I am traveling too next I would.
reviews.title: An Amazing Escape

reviews.text: From friendly helpful staff, to clean and spacious rooms to amazing food.
reviews.title: Good Price for a Good Room

reviews.text: The hotel is located downtown, on the harbour. It has amazing views and an under ground tunnel to the Market Square.(which takes you thru a downtown ped-way system)
reviews.title: Last time for me

reviews.text: The hotel is great for any one from a single traveler to families.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel for value, classy rooms and amazing staff and food.
reviews.title: Hotel with everything including great food.

reviews.text: In January 2011, I made accommodation at the Hilton Saint John. I had last stayed at this hotel seven years ago and since then, the hotel has received remodelling inside and out. In my opinion, the hotel remains one of the best accommodations in the city as it is located in the uptown area and many of the rooms overlook the harbour. The room is a typical hotel room though the newer décor gives the room a “modern/trendy” feel with the use of dark woods and draperies. A clean bed offers a very nice sleep with plenty of non-allergenic feather pillows and a thick, warm duvet. The hotel offers in-room internet access and features a good size flat screen television. Each room has an in-room safe, iron & iron board and coffee maker. The bathroom is bright and most of the fixtures are new. The bathroom in my room did not offer a hair dryer. However, despite the attempts to modernize the rooms, there is décor left over from the old room design, such as Stucco ceiling and outdated shower controls. Regardless, the room was very clean and comfortable. With onsite amenities: guest can park their car in the underground parking, a recommendation during winter months. The hotel offers a fitness room though it may be tight during peak times. The hotel is one of two hotels situated on the Pedwalk System, which means guest can walk miles without ever having to step outdoors. Also, on the Pedwalk System are countless shops and restaurants as well as Harbour Station, the New Brunswick Museum, the Saint John Regional Library and, perhaps the city’s best attraction, the City Market. In the end, the Hilton Saint John is clean and centrally located, and one of the best choices in the City of Saint John.
reviews.title: View The Harbour From Your Bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great New Year's Eve stay at the Hilton, our first time there. We had a tasteful, spacious and quiet room in which to bring in the new year.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great room, but where's the hot tub??????????

reviews.text: My wife and I always look for hotels that have an indoor pool AND a hot tub. Hilton advertises a hot tub, has pictures of it, but it's literally boarded up in the pool area. The pool was small but warm. We had a great swim but were disappointed by the lack of hot tub. The hotel should update the picture of their pool area and not advertise it as an ammenity.
reviews.title: Hotel OK but dinner meal quality atrocious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel brags that it has been renovated, which it has but only certain feature still the room wasclean and big and the bed comfy, but the main reason for this review is to warn people off eating dinner there. The dining room is closed but it's menu is available in the bar. Our starter chowder arrived cold and more like a bowl of cream than chowder, we sent it back and replaced it with a so called vegatable soup, which arrived also cold, we calle dtha manager who said he would personally take care of the issue and went to the kitchen, the next soup arrived hot but contained no vegatables, only liquid fortified with blended vegatables. We gave up on the soup and moved on to chicken wings which came to us very quickly, so quick in fact they didn't have time to cook them, they were still bloody inside. We asked for the manager again but he wasn't around so we just provided a room number and walked out - the manager never contacted us and we ended up in a bar with a pub meal - so be warned
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: We must have had the best room in the hotel. We were on thevClub floor, Harbor niew; renovated clean, We asked for a fridge an they brought one up, no charge. Breakfast buffet is worth it. Everyone is ready to make your stay pleasant.
reviews.title: Had a Harbor view room that was newly...

aka: Hilton Saint John Hotel Saint John
